alert.note: Alert for Greene; Oconee; Oglethorpe (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 29 at 8:45PM EST until January 30 at 1:51PM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Oconee River near Penfield affecting Oglethorpe, Oconee and Greene Counties. For the Oconee River Basin...including Penfield...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Oconee River near Penfield. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Flood Stage is reached. Minor flooding occurs along the river upstream and downstream from the gage on the Georgia Highway 15 bridge. The right bank begins to overflow into agricultural land and pastures with a foot or two of water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM EST Monday the stage was 13.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:00 PM EST Monday was 13.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 13.5 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.4 feet on 11/23/1997. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta. The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning at 845 AM EST.
